Posts.Content: Jul 30, 2011 06:32AM ellenquilt wrote: My body temperature is usually around 97.6.  Sometimes a little lower, not usually higher.  It was interesting to see this, as before starting chemo, I didn't take my temperature often at all.
Posts.Title: Low Body Temperature anyone? MBJ mapat

Posts.Content: Jul 26, 2011 04:10PM ellenquilt wrote: rjbaby69 Good luck to you!  I was also a Stage 1, had the lumpectomy and have started chemo.  My mother is an 11 year survivor of BC, so I have a good role model, LOL.  I'm also using her entire team, since they did such a good job for Mom.   This is a strange journey, and it's so good to have someplace to come and get support and good information!
Posts.Title: Need to Join - Got My Results rjbaby69 rjbaby69

Posts.Content: Jul 26, 2011 04:04PM ellenquilt wrote: I'm at the start of the 12 weekly herceptin+taxol sessions and I'm hoping to work straight through.  I scheduled my chemo session for Fridays, so I'd have the weekend to recoup some energy and to rest before going back to work on Monday.  I found that I felt fine Friday after the chemo, felt okay on Saturday too.  But I was soooo tired on Sunday and when I went to work yesterday after a totally sleepless night (pain and a lot of discomfort in my joints, and my upper body) I was wasted.  I went to bed before 8 p.m. and while I got up to pee a lot during the night (I'm drinking a lot of water during the day) I did grab enough sleep so that I felt almost normal for work today.   Weird though because as the day progressed, I started having pains in my knees, ankles and hip again.  Going to talk to the doc about it on Friday.  Tylenol takes the edge off.

Posts.Content: Jul 30, 2011 09:43AM ellenquilt wrote: I have psoriatic arthritis and gout, so I'm used to a certain constant low level pain.  But after my first chemo, I think the Herceptin (double dose first time) did a number on my. I had so much joint pain for three days after that it was awful.  And I can only take Tylenol, because I'm on blood thinners for A-fib.  Not much relief there.  Second chemo, my herceptin was cut in half, and I'll know tomorrow after the steroids are out of my system completely, if the pain is back or not.  Discussed with my oncologist yesterday and he thinks it was a combination of the Kytril (which he eliminated) and the herceptin.  I was able to work anyways on Monday (work is a great distraction from discomfort most of the time) so if I can forge ahead, I'm not going to let it slow me down. This whole cancer thing is forcing me to be more aware of how my body reacts to everything.
Posts.Title: anyone out there with auto-immune/chronic pain issues before dx? jessamine SuzyBlue
